info.headline: Fire Weather Watch issued July 30 at 3:12PM PDT until August 01 at 5:00AM PDT by NWS Portland
info.description: ..Isolated to Scattered Thunderstorms with Abundant Lightning On Dry Fuels Possible Sunday... .Hot and unstable conditions are expected on Sunday as an upper ridge of high pressure remains over the region. A cut-off low offshore will bring increasing midlevel moisture and southerly flow aloft. This will bring increased potential for isolated to scattered thunderstorms to develop mainly across the central Cascades of Oregon. Any storms that do develop would come with abundant lightning and strong gusty outflow winds. ...FIRE WEATHER WATCH IN EFFECT FROM SUNDAY AFTERNOON THROUGH LATE SUNDAY NIGHT FOR THUNDERSTORMS FOR FIRE WEATHER ZONE 608... The National Weather Service in Portland has issued a Fire Weather Watch for thunderstorms, which is in effect from Sunday afternoon through late Sunday night. * AFFECTED AREA...In Oregon, Fire Weather Zone 608 Willamette National Forest. * THUNDERSTORMS...3 (A chance of thunderstorms). * OUTFLOW WINDS...Gusty and erratic outflow winds of 30 to 50 mph may occur with thunderstorms. * IMPACTS...Frequent lightning and critically dry fuels may result in numerous fire starts. Thunderstorm outflow winds may result in erratic fire spread.
info.instruction: A Fire Weather Watch means that critical fire weather conditions are forecast to occur. Listen for later forecasts and possible Red Flag Warnings.
